text: The 2017–18 season was Ayr United’s 108th season of competitive football and their first season back in League One following their relegation from the Championship in the 2016–17 season. Ayr also competed in the League Cup, Scottish Cup and the Challenge Cup. ==Summary== ===Season=== In their first season back in the third–tier of Scottish football, Ayr United finished in first place and were promoted as Champions back to the Scottish Championship after only one season in League One. ==Results and fixtures== ===Scottish League One=== ===Scottish League Cup=== ====Group Stage==== ====Group E Table==== ====Knockout phase==== ===Scottish Challenge Cup=== ===Scottish Cup=== ==Squad statistics== ===Appearances=== |} ==Team statistics== ===League table=== ===Division summary=== ==Transfers== === Players in === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:95%;width:98%; text- align:left" |- !Player !From !Fee |- | Chris Higgins | Queen of the South | Free |- | Michael Moffat | Dunfermline Athletic | Free |- | Andy Geggan | Dunfermline Athletic | Free |- | Craig Moore | Motherwell | Free |- | Craig Reid | Peterhead | Free |- | David Ferguson | Motherwell | Free |- | Lawrence Shankland | Aberdeen | Free |- | Steven Bell | Stranraer | Free |- | Jack Ruddy | Wolverhampton Wanderers | Loan |- | Mark Kerr | Falkirk | Free |} === Players out === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:95%;width:98%; text-align:left" |- !Player !To !Fee |- | Daryll Meggatt | Alloa Athletic | Free |- | Peter Murphy | Annan Athletic | Free |- |- | Gary Harkins | Greenock Morton | Free |- | Greg Fleming | Peterhead | Free |- | Nicky Devlin | Walsall | Free |- | Paul Cairney | Peterhead | Free |- | Conrad Balatoni | Falkirk | Free |- | Farid El Alagui | Edinburgh City | Free |- | Lyle Avci | Troon | Loan |} == References == Category:Ayr United F.C. seasons Category:Scottish football clubs 2017–18 season
